results.title: 55 days at Peking
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Ray, Samuel Bronston and Samuel Bronston Productions
results.brief_description: During the Boxer Rebellion of 1900, a group of “foreigners” are trapped inside the Forbidden City of Peking under seige by thousands of rebellious Chinese who are determined to break free from the bonds of Imperialist intervention. Charlton Heston stars as the US Marine who leads the defence, while David Niven is the British Ambassador. The Dowager Empress (Flora Robson), and her chief advisor (Sir Robert Helpmann), try to play both sides against each other. Ava Gardner, as the beautiful Russian Countess, must make a choice between freedom and commitment.

results.title: 5 Minutes with Wlad
results.creator_credit: Roger David, Alison Wotherspoon and Flinders University
results.brief_description: The purpose of this documentary is to draw attention to the fact that sometimes, people are not what they seem to be. Far too often we tend to pass judgement on face value and often if we dig a little deeper, we will be very surprised at our findings. At first glance Wlad’s appearance pertains to all the stereotypical constructs of a vagabond or street drunk. As the camera moves in for a closer look the extraordinary world of Wlad the artist is revealed to us. The man was a POW in Poland and was forced to paint propaganda portraits of Stalin in order to save his own life while members of his family were carted off to concentration camps and killed.

results.title: 5 Films about Christo & Jeanne-Claude
results.creator_credit: Grahame Weinbren, Susan Froemke, Deborah Dickson, Charlotte Zwerin, Ellen Hovde, David Maysles, Albert Maysles and Maysles Films, Inc.
results.brief_description: Since the early 1960s Christo and Jean-Claude’s large-scale temporary works of art have worked to change our perceptions of the relationship between art and society - so writes famed documentary filmmaker Albert Maysles, a close friend of the Christos’ who has, over the decades, studied their numerous struggles to see their art realised. In these five documentaries Christo and his wife’s work habits are laid bare including their ambitions and conflicts with bureaucrats which constitute a significant portion of their work. Works include: “Christos Valley Curtain” Academy Award nominated film that celebrates the hanging of a huge orange curtain between two Colorado mountains. “Running Fence” An engrossing document of the efforts to build a 24 and 1/2 mile long, 18 foot high fence of white fabric across the hills of Northern California. “Islands” Christo and Jean-Claude fight to surround eleven islands in Miami’s Biscayne Bay with 6.5 million square feet of bright pink fabric. “Christo in Paris” The wrapping of the Pont Neuf in Paris and a portrait of the artists lasting love affair. “Umbrellas” Thousands of umbrellas are simultaneously opened in rice-farming valley in Japan and across a cluster of cattle ranches in southern California. This is great collection about an iconic artist at work that is accompanied by fascinating commentaries, a glossy booklet and an extensive interview with the artists.

results.title: 42nd Street
results.creator_credit: Lloyd Bacon, Hal B. Wallis, Vitaphone and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Here’s your ticket to “Shuffle off to Buffalo” with Ruby Keeler and Dick Powell in this beguiling Busby Berkeley showcase; a bold, enticing feast of choreography and imagination. Warner Baxter stars as Julian Marsh, a tyrannical director of Broadway musicals. When his show’s leading lady, played by Bebe Daniels, breaks her ankle on the eve of opening night, a wide-eyed chorus girl played by Ruby Keeler is thrust into the role. Also stars George Brent, Una Merkel and Dick Powell.

results.title: 37 Stories about leaving home
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In 37 Stories About Leaving Home, a group of Japanese women living in the Tokyo area recount personal stories of their own experiences of leaving home. In these stories one can begin to see, from very personal and individual perspectives, the societal changes that have occurred over the last three generations for women in Japan, bringing an exciting and often conflicting array of choices and positions. Many of the stories revolve around the relationships these grandmothers, mothers and daughters have with each other, filled with respect, rebellion, loss and love. The interviews are framed by a traditional Japanese folktale, a magical and somewhat shocking narrative of a mother’s search for her abducted daughter, kidnapped by a monster on the eve of her wedding.

results.title: 3 seconds from glory. [Part 1]
results.creator_credit: David Goldie, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Spirit 2000 Productions
results.brief_description: Part one of a 2-part documentary about four young female Paralympians in the pursuit of excellence. At World Championship level, Australia had never won a women’s wheelchair relay event, nor been able to field a team at the time of making this documentary. But all this changed. Louise Sauvage (24 years old), Australia’s best wheelchair athlete and international medal winner, used her inspirational powers to gather a team together. This team consisted of Christie Skelton (18 years old), Angie Ballard (16 years old), Holly Ladmore (14 years old) and of course, Louise. David Goldie takes us into the lives of these four young women, two who were born with their handicap and two who became paraplegics through the tragic consequences of car accidents. His sensitive interviews with the girls and their families gives an insight to the focus and determination and the wonderful spirit in each of them, individually, and as a team. Louise, Holly, Christie and Angie are seen in training three weeks before the 1998 IPC Disability World Athletics Championship being held at Birmingham, England. Each has to compete in an individual event but it is the relay which unites and motivates them as a team. Introduced and narrated by David Goldie.

results.title: 36 Fillette
results.creator_credit: Catherine Breillat, Valerie Seydoux, Emmanuel Schlumberger and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The title refers to a child’s dress size, which the film’s heroine, Lili, has unmistakably outgrown. A sullen, uncommunicative 14 year old vacationing with her family in Biarritz, Lili is clearly ready to strike out on her own. She does so by dressing up in jeans, a corset and a raincoat, then hitching a ride to the local nightclub in search of adventure. Not surprisingly, adventure comes her way! “36 Fillette”, written and directed by French novelist Catherine Breillat, is based on one of her novels.

results.title: 24 Hour party people
results.creator_credit: Michael Winterbottom, Andrew Eaton, Baby Cow, Film Four International, Film Council, United Artists Corporation, Revolution Films and Film Consortium
results.brief_description: This mockumentary is set during Manchester’s rise in the music world from the late 70’s post punk era through to the 80’s rave scene. Inspired by the Sex Pistols Tony Wilson (Steve Coogan) a Cambridge graduate television presenter, starts a record label signing up the band “Joy Division” and then on to running the “Hacienda” nightclub. From depressive post punk morbidness comes “New Order” and then “Happy Mondays” are found. This hedonistic and exciting film shot on digital video shows well the life of drugs, excess and seedy dealing that go hand in hand with the music industry. “24 Hour Party People” is very funny. Those who were around during this important era will enjoy the soundtrack and reminisce to the sounds of “Joy Division”, “New Order”, “Buzzcocks”, “The Clash” and the “Happy Mondays”. Tough Northern humour, outrageous self abuse and self mocking throughout this is a fine portrayal of the Manchester music scene.

results.title: 21 grams = Twenty one grams
results.creator_credit: Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu, Robert Salerno, Y Production, This Is That and Focus Features
results.brief_description: Following a tragic accident, three people’s lives are connected in a way that is emotionally intense and devastating. Christine (Naomi Watts) is a wife and mother of two girls. Paul (Sean Penn) is a mathematician with a congenital heart problem and a troubled relationship. Jack (Benicio Del Toro) is an ex-con, born-again Christian and father of two children. This revenge-style drama could be told in a straight forward way but the writer Guillermo Arriaga and director Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu have chosen a non-linear approach with the story told by glimpses forward and back until becoming clear to the viewer just how these people’s lives do connect. The three leads are convincing in their performances with Watts and Del Toro being nominated for Academy Awards and Sean Penn for a BAFTA.
